Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style or black-figured Komast or Animal, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus bud and lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; graffito inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on the exterior suggests that the sherd may come from a Simple Animal Style chalice or from an undecorated section of a black figure komast or animal chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1232) (phase 2)
